akn:section.akn:heading: Continuing jurisdiction and closing of the case

akn:content.akn:p:
§ 945. Continuing jurisdiction and closing of the case(a) The court may retain jurisdiction over the case for such period of time as is necessary for the successful implementation of the plan.
(b) Except as provided in subsection (a) of this section, the court shall close the case when administration of the case has been completed.
(Pub. L. 95–598, Nov. 6, 1978, 92 Stat. 2625; Pub. L. 98–353, title III, § 498, July 10, 1984, 98 Stat. 384.)
Historical and Revision Notes senate report no. 95–989Section 948 [enacted as section 945] permits the court to retain jurisdiction over the case to ensure successful execution of the plan. The provision is the same as that found in section 96(e) of Chapter 9 of the present Act [section 416(e) of former title 11].
Editorial Notes Amendments1984—Subsec. (a). Pub. L. 98–353 substituted “implementation” for “execution”.
